newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore HSFO firm in $120-$123/T range.
newsitem.headline: Singapore HSFO firm in $120-$123/T range.

text.p: High sulphur fuel oil prices on Tuesday were assessed firm on overnight crude gains and strong fundamentals, traders said.
Traders expected bids/offers to hover around the current range of $120-$123 per tonne for free-on-board December liftings from Singapore.
They said the market remained healthy with Chinese demand and dampened supplies from South Korean refineries which are running more low sulphur crude to maximise distillate production.
High sulphur 180 centistoke fuel oil was quoted at $121/$123 per tonne on Monday.
Another trader said cash levels are likely to track swaps quotes, December swaps were indicated at $120.50/$121.50 against Monday's quotes at $119.25/$120.50 per tonne.
But as crude eased on profit-taking interest, traders said the current price support may be curtailed.
